description:
I heard about Reina's from a Lyft ride from a local who was born and raised in this area. In this area, there are many immigrants from Central American and they have heavily influenced the food in this area. By no means is this place fancy but this place has the best pupusas in the city IMO. My first experiences of food from El Salvador was when I was living in Los Angeles and I absolutely fell in love with pupusas. Good pupusas to me are first of all HOT all the way through, slightly crispy on the outside, cheesy on the inside, not too heavy with masa on the edges but pretty even with ingredients through the middle - and that's the kind of pupusa you're going to get with Reinas.

I hear all these people with the bad service and sanitary issues - meh. I'm a foodie first and everything comes second. I didn't see anything and the service was great. No problem. Standing with this local business.
author: Tinaa W.

description:
This is "the beer", second to none!
Great with siete mares soup or whatever you desire
author: Felix A.

description:
The food wasn't good I order huevos rancheros with plátanos fritos yesterday and casamiento
And that food and it wasn't taste at all and also I order pupusas not even close what I expecting
I never will come again at this place and I'm not recommending this place at all
author: Edwin A.

description: These reviews are all lies I went to eat there for the first time today and not only did I receive bad service but as I took my first bite of food I saw a mouse coming out the kitchen and the waitress did nothing she straight up ignore that there was a mouse running around and preferred for us to leave then apologies at that point I was soooooo grossed out!!!! That I just wanted to run out of that place as fast as possible!!!!!
author: Cloudy A.

description: I went on Sunday July 15, 2018. The only food that taste good that day was the pupusas of Chesse and the pupusas of cheese with beans. Their horchata & tamarindo drinks had no flavor they were watered down. sopa de pata had no flavor to watery. Siete mares tasted gross it had to much crema in the soup. Zucchini pupusas didn't taste good. They were  short staffed & you could tell that the person who made the food was not Salvadorean. Too bad that was my favorite place for soap de path. Frugal, C the coleslaw that goes on top of the pupusas is called curtido and it's Salvadorean coleslaw not Mexican that we put on top of our Salvadorean pupusas.
author: Nancy R.

description: Food is ok I guess if you're hungry, don't come here with very high expectations, soup has no flavor, the burrito and taco combination was kinda weird, I thought it was a regular taco like Salvadoreans taco, soft tortilla, but nopppp! It was hard shelf like Taco Bell  to sad. I'm not coming back!
author: Brenda E.

description: Best chicken soup I've had in the city!! Service is amazing and the food is even better :D this place is SO underrated. If you like big portions and delicious, made from scratch everything this is your spot!!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
A-M-A-Z-I-N-G

Great customer service and delicious food.

The pupusas are to die for!

Love the platanos and get their special 2 pupusas and a soup.

Highly recommend
author: A B.

description:
I came to this area to as usual go to McDonalds after getting off the 14 bus(it's near Guttenberg St) to rest and have a short eat-drink break, but I saw Reina's right across from McD's and wanted to try it out.  It's pretty spacious with big tables, lots of lights, and a large tv with lots of families who dine here.  They accept CC's.  I did not see any roaches.  They did NOT discriminate against me - I'm asian.  The bathroom was as clean as it could be when you compare it out in the outer mission with other restos.   

 They first served LOTS of yummy thin crunchy just warmed chips with salsa sauce that was pretty mild which I finished off quickly with my jamaica agua fresca.  Their cheese pupusas were thick and fluffy and warm and FILLED with creamy cheese!! YUM!! (you have to order a minimum of 2 pupusas).  I could tell that they had really great homecooking because the usual mexican coleslaw that came with the pupusa was soft and tasty & not too hot, not hard and chewy & hot that you usually find near Mission & 30th St.    

I couldnt eat anymore and so I had my mexican super burrito to go--they gave me LOTS more chips with a BIG cup of their tasty salsa sauce--later when I had space in my tummy to eat it,  I found the filling was too soft and mushy which tasted mainly like bland rice.  

The service was friendly & fast!!  I would definitely go back to Reina's rather than McDs.  I would try the other El Salvadoran dishes in addition to the cheese pupusas and stay away from the mexican food.
author: Frugal C.

description: I love their pupusas... definitely my go to place if I want to get some good ass pupusas.
author: Sammie B.

description:
Good food good people 
I had  tamales corn ones and drinks are good horchata and all
author: Karina C.

description: The food is good this place is salvadorean so I don't understand why the people looking for mexican food on Salvadoran place  I like the pupusas for me the best in San Francisco.!!!
author: E R.

description: I can't say enough about Reina's Restaurant. I love their food, their specialty Salvadoran Churrasco. Yum
author: Anthony B.

description: This place is racist. I ordered 2 tacos and waited for 20 minutes while watching people that ordered after me get their food. I didn't get my food until I complained and was about to leave. I talked to my local friends about it and they says the same exact things. Terrible food and terrible service. I couldn't even eat it.  She also charged me 7 tacos while she charged the person after me 5.
author: Nima A.

description:
Generally the food and service here is pretty good, however recently, the cooks started adding chili spice to the salsa and curtido cabbage mix.  I dont remember it being spicy, and definitely not as spicy as it is now.  Salvadoran food is generally known to be refreshing and have cool and savory flavors and generally is not spicy. 

Today I called Reinas restaurant to advise them that the salsa and curtido cabbage was exceedingly spicy and the woman who answered the phone hung up on me. When I called back again, she had a bad attitude and said in Spanish "En El Salvador no usamos chile pero aqui si" which roughly means in English, "In El Salvador we dont use chili, --but here we do."

How rude.  All I wanted was an option for salsa and curtido that reflected the taste of El Salvador, and if I could not...then could they create an optional mild salsa and curtido. Instead what I got is attitude.  I doubt that I will be back to eat at this dump.

Its not worth it with all the Tums I've had to eat to stop the burning from their overspiced condiments.

The bad attitude has added two extra stars reducing it to 1 star for review.
author: Dan R.

description:
Horrible place, very small, the waiter we got paid very little attention to us. I ordered a shrimp cocktail and there was mold on the crackers. When I went to pay I showed her and she just smiled and threw it aside. 
My daughter had also ordered a hot chocolate and she kept forgetting and brought it until she was halfway done with her food.
author: Myrna A.

description:
Awesome friendly waiter, she was attentive and moved fast! 
I got the combo of 2 pupusas and caldo de pollo, which also comes with handmade tortillas. Yummy!

They have authentic horchata here, not the one everyone is used to drinking! Yummy!
author: Kimberlyn F.

description: Whenever I crave pupusas and don't feel like driving far, I get my fix here since it's literally down the street from my house. I always order to go, but on those several occasions where I came in before my food was ready, I got these vibes from the lady working the front of the house that I'm not welcome. She gives me nasty attitude whenever I talk to her. At least the cheese pupusas are pretty good. It's a good thing I've never found a roach in my food.
author: AJ C.

description:
Flavor is so-so... I've tried many dishes from here is not actually like we cook it at home nor as mom used to make.. But still, good food for a good price, main waitress is very polite and she puts extra efforts to make it a good experience (at least for me the times I've been there).
What i don't really like is the music so loud, but that's pretty common in our country in this kind of restaurants.
author: Edwin M.

description:
They had the worst Sopa de Gallina, trying to fool me giving water with vegetables  and some knor suiza chicken both.
Did't taste like Sopa de pollo  or gallina
I think a chicken cup noodles tastes better.
Service slow 
Customer  Service rude
Not going back never
Or their past elites where awful too.
Go to MonteCristo Restaurant better.
author: Margarita L.

description: The food was good I had the chicken soup and it was very flavorful but the reason I'm not giving it more stars is because the restroom was disgusting and it didn't look like they were gonna do anything about it which made me think of how my good is prepared
author: Ines F.

description:
Never had I had such tasty and authentic Salvadorian food in the Bay Area. Not only was it good, it was affordable for the large portions they have! 
Ordered the plato tipico and an order of platanos fritos, both were delicious!! Super loaded with food and flavor. The owner, Reina herself, came to help our table and was very welcoming. Highly recommend this place.
author: Johana M.

description: I've honestly been coming here since I've been a little kid and never ever have had a problem here. This place has the best pupusas in the city. I also recommend getting their 7 mares soup with full of delicious flavors and different types of seafood. The service in here is very speedy from what I've experienced. There're two servers that have been working here at least 20 years+ Concha and Reina(Not to get confused with the owner Reina) who are always on top of guests that come in the restaurant and always greet me with a smile.
author: Luis M.

description: Only gave this restaurant a star because I had to. I came to eat here with my mom and ended finding not 1 but 3 cockroaches in my food. Plus the place is run down and dirty. Don't recommend this place at all. Food is not even worth the money you pay for.
author: Jasmine D.

description: Reina's discriminates against race we are not Hispanic djtvy6555yy555=g=5-5r5t6--fR5=--5555t555f-f5f-f-ggg""=
author: Kelli C.

description: Love this Salvadoran food! You MUST get the plantains with beans and cream! To die for! I also had the menudo and pupusas! I'm not a fan of pupusas but the cheese ones are amazing! Small place but true authentic Salvadoran food!
author: Clarice D.

description: Posting for my sister as she does not have a Yelp account. She found a roach her soup. Not much to say the picture is self explanatory and they still made her pay for the beers! Not cool.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Truly a disappointment! 

It appeared they ran out of cheese on my visit because my papusa's lacked "queso." That along with the plastic trays that allow the grease to soak through the wax paper is truly disgusting! You almost wish they didn't remove the trays before you leave (clear the table), so that you wouldn't have to see the puddle of grease. I would have been happier with paper plates, believe it or not.
author: Owl H.

description:
Came in late on Friday night for a couple of burritos to go.
The ladies working there were nice, they spoke no english.
The place is kind of on the dirty side, not sure of their rating.
We took the food back to the room and neither of us finished the burritos.
One beef, one pork and both had a distinct sour smell and taste.
We tossed them. Nobody was sick the next day though!
I would not try them again.
author: Joe T.

description: This place is always packed! I love their papusas, and always get the caldo de res. The only problem is that it can get pretty cramped and confusing. Sometimes food doesn't come to tables in the order that it was taken.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Terrible service. The Racist owner will put Spanish speaking customers ahead of everyone else, even if you ordered first. I'm not imagining this either; it happened twice on two separate occasions, months apart.

So do the math:

Thirty minutes for two papusas.

Wait patiently for thirty minutes: Get two average tasting papusas. 


Get this: the owner ****ing slaps on your table to get your attention, what the **** is her problem?

Never again, plus, the food isn't anything special to begin with. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
author: Iroquois S.

description: If I could give negative stars I would. Found a dead roach on my pupusa. First and last time I ever attempt to eat here.
author: Michelle G.

description:
I always try time & time again to give this place a chance but the food is always terrible I don't know if it's me ordering the wrong food or something . . 

1) ambiance is okay not that bad , they should clean around on their free time . . 

2) it shouldn't take almost an hour for some to go food shouldn't that be super fast to come out ? , since it's TO-GO ? . 

3) it's not even busy right now , only three tables are being used . . & the people who are dinning just walked in probably 20 minutes ago & got all there food , I've been here 45+ minutes & still haven't received  NOTHING . I honestly just hope my food isn't crap this time around it isn't fare smh .
author: Kimberly G.

description:
UPDATE: Better experience this time!

There was nowhere to go so late and with a heavy heart I had to stop by here since my usual place gave me food poisoning. What a great choice in turned out to be. I was quoted 10 min for two super burritos ($7), and they came out on time with two bags of chips and salsa. It was really good and I can say I won't mind going back! Btw, it was all different staff this visit :-)
-----------
This place is garbage. I waited for 30 minutes and watched as the waitress ran the house and the cooks handled the kitchen. Filthy. Cook had a shirt that was stuck up her back, showing her sweaty skin. The waitress never washed her hands. So disappointed and not worth the wait or money.
author: Marilyn D.

description: Very Bad Customer Service. I am never coming here again. Food is okay. The waitress totally ignored  us for some reason but she decided to take everyone else's order that came in after us. She finally takes our order and brings chips. She brings everyone else their drinks but us so we had to wait after our chips and I went up to her to ask her about our drinks. She acts like she doesn't know what I'm saying. That was my experience here. Also the place is not that clean.
author: Bedilia V.

description:
Haven't written a review for quite away since my last one.
.......................................................................................................................................
 overall the the food is good and got what I wanted (2 cheese & beans pupusas) BUT when I got home and start eating. It didnt expect as I want it to be. I asked for a BLACK BEANS & cheese pupusas NOT brown beans. I even asked to be sure that I have stated black beans before I left. They said yes so okay, I go ahead n' get home. Ugh...... Plus, earlier the woman on phone didnt sound extra patient enough either to be sure of what she got it down. Especially, when I wonder what drinks do they have to offer. Unlike the one that's near my house thats close to me. :\ mehhh. Dont think I'll like to go there anymore. Gives me the creeps/awkwardness.
author: Lorrine L.

description: If you're in the area and want some badass El Salvadorian food, hit this place up. Their soups are the shit.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Pupusas = okay
Sopa = DELICIOUS (esp. the beef one!)
I want to eat it day and night......
Chips = delicious, and their salsa = addicting!!!!!!! 
Prices = reasonable.
Service = friendly.
author: Fannie S.

description:
This place is awesome! Simply stated it has good food, good service and is a hit. The food is made fresh, and you can always be sure that Reina's serves authentic salvadorean food as a salvadorean myself. 

If your on the fence about this place, just go! You won't be disappointed. 

When you come in you can now that the locals love this place too. It is always packed and people are constantly raving about this place. My favorite order is "The Sopa de Pata with 2 pupusas" for 10.95 it is affordable and fills you up quickly! Come over to Reinas you'll understand why I'm so in love with this place
author: Jordan S.

description:
The pupusas here are delicious. They are lucky they are so delicious because everything else about them is terrible.

The experience: 
I came in when only half of the tables were full. Most of the patrons were already eating, or had just put in their order. Great, I said to myself, no wait!! I put in an order of four pupusas, one burrito, and one shrimp cocktail to-go. So I sit down and wait. I watched a two groups come in after me, sit, order and receive their food before me. It would've been no big deal if my order came a few minutes after. No. The group next to me ordered pupusas,  soup, and two entrees. Wtf? When I inquired about my order, the woman said it's coming up next. I witness other tables being served their food. Who does that? You can't put my order in last just because it's to-go. When I finally received my food, I got the apology I deserved, but she added, "you should have phoned in your order, then you wouldn't have to wait." I lost it. You're really going to blame me? Seriously? 

They also let really creepy old men hang out and drink beer. They literally just sit and stare at you. Gross. 

Honestly, phone in your order if you have the pupusas craving. The food really is good.
author: Lisa L.

description: I love this place! There food is delicious! Pupusas always on point, there sopa de pata just how my mom makes it. BUT horrible service but honestly all Salvadorian restaurants are like that! If you just are craving Salvi food call in and pick it up! Sometimes they take longer than the approximate time they give you.
author: Danette D.

description:
Never had anything else but the papusas.

The older latin lady at work told me about this spot, so it has to be good right?

Papusas are theeeeeeee best here. Never over cooked, juicy tasty meat and cheese inside, & the dough is not overwelmingly thick. Its the perfect papusa. My fav is the pork and cheese.

10 papusas for $22.... Once a week, my son loves them. I cant speak on the other food, but it cant be bad, this place is usually packed on the weekends.
author: Mono L.

description: Wow, this place is absolutely horrible. I'm sorry I chose this place over the McDonald's across the street. Horrible service, extremely long wait for food and an even longer wait to get the check. I've had some fairly mediocre enchiladas/rice/beans combination plates in my life but this was downright horrible. The "red enchilada sauce?" tasted rotten and out of a can and everything had the nasty stale taste of canned chiles and jalepenos. Gross. Absolutely inedible. Soggy tortillas covered in rotten sauce. Twice when customers started complaining about the wait and why their to-go orders weren't ready, they just turned on the music at a super loud obnoxious level....and then after a few minutes it would stop.....then you could here the super loud obnoxious music coming from a customer's cell phone. Zero stars. Yuck.
author: Isaac K.

description: One of the better Papusas places in the outer mission. Service seemed fine to me, so I don't get why so many people are complaining....especially if you can leave being full and having had a beer for under $10. People shouldn't expect 5-star dining from every establishment they visit. It's all about getting over yourself  ;)
author: Brandon J.

description:
You don't come for the burritos!

I'm new to the Mission district when it comes to food but it couldn't be helped since I was craving for a good burrito. I'm also a total nub when it comes to authentic Mexican style food too; All I know is Tacos, Burritos, Doritos, and Crunch Wrap Supreme -- that's it! Evidently, my girlfriend brought me to Reina's to attempt to change that perspective and introduce me to some Salvadorean food. 

Grilled Steak Tostada - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=1yQLC5PT43Kacx8E76fb_A&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
We started with a Tostada (your choice of chicken, grilled steak of ground beef) and it was huge! (see picture). Grilled steak, lettuce, pico de gio, avocado, and cheese crumbles everywhere. You couldn't even see the tortilla! But despite the mess, it was very fresh and delicious.

Pupusas - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=I4Cc00XwtcHpka7jcNoSXg&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
This was my first time trying Pupusas so I didn't know what to expect. My girlfriend said it was like a taco.. but better. When the dish arrived, it resembled more like a adult size Lunchable (make it yourself food). Two big corn tortillas, which were stuffed with fried pork and cheese within, refried beans, rice, and a caggabe salad, but combined together, WOW! -- the savory pork, melty cheese, crisp salad, creamy beans, all wrapped in a warm tortilla blew my mind on Central American food. 

Burrito Super - 
It's what I came here for in the beginning, right? Your choice of beef stew, pork stew, or shredded beef, with the standard rice, beans, guac, and sour cream; the burrito sure was super in size, but it was just a-okay and the stewed beef was a tad plain. My girlfriend told me not to order a burrito from the start but I wanted to play it "safe", and in the end, she was right. LISTEN TO YOUR GIRLFRIEND, GENTS.

Reina's serves up some good Salvadoran eats, and this being my first time, I've become a fan! Each dish is overwhelming huge, lots of flavor and freshness, and I can't argue with a bill of (slightly over) only $20. The Horchata wasn't much to my liking though, tasted too rich and "corny" but maybe that's just me. Chips and salsa are also complimentary with your dine-in visit (the salsa was bomb! It was so good I wanted to drink the stuff, really!). I'll sure be back when i need a Pupusa fix!
author: Albert L.

description: I like food from here but their customer service sucks if ypu are not latino/latina. Thr people of service gives you attitude... i gave them 3 stars cuz I like the pupusas but the customer service sucks. Some are nice but the others just dont smile at you... they always look like they are mad all the time and they say things and not knowing if you understand or not...
author: Shay P.

description: Driest chicken I have ever tasted. Made me choke. Would never go here again. Not when El Farallito is a few blocks away.  Saw a cockroach crawl up the wall. They give mexican food a bad name. They should close down. -5 stars.
author: Attic F.

description: Ordered 5 Pupusas on a walk in tonight March 16,2016. It should not take 1 hour. Especially after 5 tables were seated, served,  ate and left. I knew they were talking long, but when i looked at my receipt time it had been an hour and still no food. They tried to tell me that the Pupusas did not come out right. WTF! I asked them how did they think that my food an hour later was okay. Then I think it was the owner tells me those customers did not order Pupusas they ordered food. Again...then I pointed at everyone's plate and I tell the lady in charge who thinks I am blind, "well it looks like everyone is eating Pupusas to me." Which they obviously were. Really...really...give me my money back, which they did. Thanks for wasting my time. If the food was going to be late The least they could have done was let me know they were running late with my food. Lost a customer due to lack of their own common sense and lousy customer service. I could get better food elsewhere. Yup I did just say all that!
author: Sez R.

description: A couple of years ago my roommate would order from Reina's for our dinner and the food was very, very good.  The pupusas;  the typical Salvadorean platter; enchiladas; nachos.  But, lately the food quality and service has deteriorated a bit.  Earlier this year we had pupusas which were the tortilla part was thick and there were not enough cheese...more masa than queso.   My rookie even mentioned that there was a sign on the window that they were hiring an experienced cook- especially one who could make pupusas.  My roomie ordered chicken soup and all that was in it were vegetables- no chicken and very over-cooked rice.  Someone mentioned the fact that they serve Latino customers first.  But what happens when your roommate is Latina and her beverage was given to another customer and she had to wait another 10 minutes for her beverage.  We'll probably still order but if the food quality and service continue to deteriorate, I'm very tempted to write a Yelp review in Spanish.
author: Arthur P.

description: I'm not going to lie - I have no idea what I ordered.  Everything on the menu is in Spanish and my few years of high school Spanish didn't include Salvadorian dishes.  Nonetheless, I was late getting home and promised I'd bring home dinner.  I was the only non-Latin in the place which I took as a good sign.  I told the woman I wanted something with pork and something with chicken.  When I got the dinners home, we were pleasantly surprised.  My boyfriend got a cheese and pork pupusa, friend yucca, something on a corn meal base (kind of like a mini-corn tostada but better), and deep friend stewed pork.  He was in heaven!  I got 2 pieces of marinated chicken with a nice crispy skin, rice, homemade refried beans, a salad, and thick homemade tortillas.  Along with a soda, it came out to be about $25 and wound up being 2 meals worth each.  We'd definitely go bacik
author: Jessica G.

description: I love their food but the wait time can be long during weekends since they are always busy. Nice place for pupusa, price is cheap!
author: Karla S.

description: Me LOVE Pupusas and if your in the neighborhood I suggest you try them! BOMB
author: Myra S.

description:
I've never eaten in the restaurant -- always picked food up and taken it home. The bf swears by the papusas here, says they're the best... and his Salvadorian family agrees. I'm not a big fan of papusas so I always order the carne asada tacos. Nothing special, but they give you TONS of meat and they're still yummy.

This is our go to pick up spot for dinner. 5 stars for the papusas from the boy and 3.5 stars for the tacos. Service is not great... my spanish speaking boyfriend is treated well but I'm not treated so well when I go by myself to pick up the food.
author: Erica W.

description:
Mum and I have been regular customers of this place for over 7 years, and we absolutely LOVE the food.  

We've been to places like La Santaneca, El Faro's, and Balompie to name a few pupuserias in the city, but for us, we prefer Reina's.  To say that they're the best pupusas in the world is irrelevant.  I can't speak for places outside of San Francisco.  However, in my opinion, they are by far the best in the City, but that's just me.  The chefs put in just the right amount of ingredients, and they aren't cooked to a point where they taste burned like lots of other places I've been to.

The reason why I'm only giving the place 4 stars, pretty much goes back to what previous reviewers have said about the service being a bit slow, when you dine in.  Another downside is if you're seated near the kitchen.  I don't know if it's just me, or if it's the fact that they are extremely noisy in the kitchen -- I'm talking about plates clattering, spatulas and pots clanging, and loud jukebox music.  If you're dining with friends and plan to engage in conversation, be prepared to holler at each other a little.  Unfortunately, the music is loud in the restaurant.

Otherwise the food is superb.  However, if you don't want to wait too long for the food, try the takeout method.  Just call in, and place your order.  They will tell you how long the waiting period is, so you can plan when to come into the restaurant and pick it up.
author: Claudine P.

description: The first time I went in, the service was decent, perhaps because there was nobody there. This last time I went in I was pretty much ignored for half an hour. I should have walked out but I kept thinking it would only take another minute. Person after person that ordered after me got their food before me. It was only after another costumer told the waitress that it looks like they forgot about me that she got my food.
author: Nathan M.

description: Honestly they suck. Their carne asada was extremely dry and their pupusas aren't that great
author: Bob B.

description:
Papusas are good but the service sucks. i waited nearly 15 min. before the older waitress noticed that we have been ready to eat or order something. She paid too much attention to talking with the regulars and not the ones around who have been waiting for someone to take their order.

I can understand that they become personable with their regulars..but your not gonna get new business in when lack quick service to new folks and be tentative all around, not just to your regulars but to the whole visitors in general.  We should have just taken our order to go.  I felt as if my party (of 3) were just ignored. Good portion of serving, food is just ok, but i rate things overall. I would have to say this is the worst service I've ever had.. I'll give them another star just for the food alone but they certainly need to pick up on the service. This place is quaint and small and there were 3 other table being served, so you see..it was not that busy. 

She came to our table 2x, once to take our order.. after almost waiting 20 min. the other time was to refill my coffee.. after I have flagged her 2x and waited almost half an hour for the second coffee refilll. The 3rd time she was suppose to come and give us the check, i had to flag her, again she got consumed by another table of regulars.. with just regular conversation and i had to flag another waitress who just came in her shift... If she is the owner or family member, they need to stop and look around and see if others are needing to be tended to and not chit chat away..it was just ridiculously making us feel we should not eat here.. 

that terrible.. Won't come back again..sorry. Very bad service. I suggest take out if you love papusas.
author: Ateh M.

description: Poor service. Had to wait 10 minutes just to order pupusas. Waiter didn't give me a glass of water. I don't know why she even asked me if I wanted anything to drink. She gave me my food, no napkins, no fork. Yeah I guess was suppose to eat with my bare hands in public. Smh.
author: Margot G.

description: I have always noticed the place walking home from school, so I finally decided to go in and check it out. The service was so-so, the waitress could've been more attentive but the wait wasn't that bad.  I order the pupusas and sopa de Rez. The pupusas were delicious!!!! The soap de Rez was okay, a little on the bland side, I've had better but still ok. Will definitely go back for more
author: Monique S.

description:
I heard they had the best pupusas in SF and I will have to agree.  

This is where I've first had pupusas years ago and I'll never have it anywhere else.  It comes with a cabbage salad and sauce - winner!

I was actually craving for tamales, the reason for my stop here.  It was very disappointing.  It was very soft, mushy masa wrapped in banana leaf.  It did not taste like tamales at all.  Well, I maybe naive, but perhaps that's how they do it in El Salvador.   Nonetheless, I'm not a fan.

Good price and I'm happy it's in my hood.
author: Pam S.

description: Cool hole in the wall place for Salvadorian food. The pupusas with the salad thing is good and they have a bumping sound system. You pay something like $1-2 to have your favorite Latin top 40 blaring in the background when you're stuffing your face in delicious food. I'm gonna start going here after my haircuts.
author: Matthew P.

description:
You'd have gotten five stars for your $2.00 pupusas - but I could have done without your attitude when I ordered.

Even with the attitude, tho - I will be back because those pupusas were off the chain!

GREAT spot to run in and grab some grub but dont expect a smile - oh well, I was there for the food anyhow so Reina, its all good!
author: Peggy N.

description:
Best pupusas in SF? Really?

I liked Reina's, I did, but "best" is a term I don't use lightly. 

It was a very standard Salvadorian restaurant: good food, cheap, loud music, ok service.

Pupusas were about $3 for dinner and the horchata was $2.

I would definitely go back when I want to have pupusas but I wouldn't go as far as saying they were the best.
author: Carlos A.

description: I have been going to this place for years now...pupusas....ohhh..it's my favorite!!! They make it when you order....that means you have to wait...but it's always ok..and I love the cabbage dish..I'll come again and again!!
author: L G.

description: I've been to this place twice & they're Pupusas are BOMB.. I love them & so does my mom.. I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jai M.

description:
My husband & I were out shopping one day and happen to stumble into this restaurant.  We didn't know what to expect.  The restaurant is a small place with interesting photos of El Salvador.  We dicided to give it a try.  I ordered beef and chicken crunchy tacos and my husband ordered some kind of steak combo platter.  We both were afraid that was not enough food so we also ordered the Seven Seas soup. Let me tell you, our eyes were way too big for our tummy at that time.  It was sooooo much food we barely made a dent on anything.  Everything we ordered was delicious except the chicken tacos, a bit dry, but everything else was excellent.  If you haven't try the Seven seas, you gotta try that.  The soup-base was yummy.  The waitress was so friendly.  

People always say that in order to know whether a restaurant is really good or not, you must go back a few times to confirm our opinion.  We went back again the second time to try other stuff and the result was still the same.  Excellent food and services.
author: Sue N.

description:
Big Delicious Pupusas. Two are enough to fill me up with a lot of curtido and salsa and to drink a KolaKhampan. Oh yeah and I cant live without their refried beans with melted cheese with Chips.. mmmmmHmmm

ALWAYS Satisfied.
author: Mariajose A.

description: I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE, AT ALL. I used to come here to eat  at night times and was one of my favorite places to go. But on my last visit, it was just the most horrible service I've ever received anywhere. I came in to eat with my friend and we had just ordered our food. Then some minutes later, I saw a cockroach walking on the wall of the restaurant, right by my table! I was soooo grossed out. We told the waiter (which I believed was the Owner of the place), and her response was, "oh, we have a lot of them around". Really!? thats ur response! The food came over and i tried eating alittle cause I was hungry. But I stopped and ate maybe not even a fourth of the plate and told the lady I can't eat anymore cause I was disgusted by the cockroach on the wall. She gave me a face and left. Then I told her again and to take the plate away cause I was not going to eat anymore, then she throws a fit at me and gets mad at me for not eating her food. Telling me that I ate already most of it. I told her how dare she even give me attitude after seeing a roach in her restaurant and her not doing anything about it. How maybe she can eat with roaches but I can't. The nerve of the servant. And still charged me for the food. Is the laaaaast time I ever go there. Horrible Horrible Horrible. Thats not how you treat your customers.
author: Roxanna V.

description: Came here last night w/ mom & babe. The Pupusas are amazing! So good, in my opinion. Sopa de Res had so much flavor it was delicious! Mom had chiyote she loved it. Definitely coming back for some more Salvadorian food. The only thing is the wait, they make you wait a lil long but the food is worth it!
author: D M.

description:
Came here for lunch. 
My friend had a chicken burrito.  He said it sucked and would've rather gone to El Farolitos.

I had the pupusas were dry and rubbery.  

The filling was decent. 

I asked for more curtido but never received it.

I know there has to be something better in SF.  I'll find it, god willing I WILL FIND IT!!
author: Sun T.

description:
As I was craving pupusas so badly for weeks, I needed to get my fix-up this weekend.  My friend suggested to go to Reina's, and we all went there last night.

It's on Outer Mission/Balboa Park-ish neighborhood that I almost never go to eat.  The restaurant was full of native-looking people, so I knew I could expect something good and authentic.

We ordered vegetarian pupusas, chicken tamales, chicken turkey sandwich, deep fried shrimp, and corn soup (cornflower drink).  Way too much for 3 people, and we killed them all.  It was SO good, and the total was around $40, and it can easily feed 4 people for that amount of food.  It's definitely not a fancy-schmancy type of restaurant to take someone out for the first date, but it's a place for good Salvadorian food.  Also, if you want to have meaningful or serious conversations over meal, Reinas may not the the place as their juke box is so loud that you can't hear much of others.

I've heard their Mexican variety is not as good as Salvadorian.  Salvadorian variety is recommended at Reina's.

I would given 5 stars if they had sangria!  (They have non-alcoholic ones though)

Update: 
Who cares about drinks...  Reinas was the best Salvadorian I've had so far.  5 stars.
author: Yoko S.

description: I usually only order the pupusas from here and they are really good.  I like the mixed ones with meat and cheese.  I recommend you calling ahead for take out because on busy nights they can take about 30min to make.
author: Mirna V.

description:
I'll keep it simple. You hungry? In the more for Salvadorena food? Then you must be thinking Reinas. I've been a few times, thought nothing special (except the chips & salsa)  until I had the Pupusas one day, they were hella good. Me & my party kept eating and didn't talk until we were done. When I left, I already was planning my next trip there, and it was going to be asap!! Food did take a tad long, but at that price, and tasting that good, well worth the wait.

Best chips & salsa in the city!! Best Pupusas in the city!!
author: Isiah B.

description:
Go there! The Salvadoreans do! 
Get the sopa de gallina if you have a hangover, cuz it's magic.
author: Shirley M.

description: Really good chicken taco, and a solid chicken burrito.  Looking forward to going back to try the pupusas.
author: Oleg H.

description: i called one time to ask them if they had an iten in their menu because they were out of it on other ocasions and a rude lady told me that they were busy and to stop calling. this just did it for me. i won't be going here anymore because of that and the fact that some items okn the menu are sometimes not in their inventory. i will be going to other better popuserias from now on. focus on your customer service and have more inventory so you can keep the few customers you have.
author: Tom L.

description:
I was sick last week with what I thought was strep.  I managed to guilt trip some buddies of mine to swing by Reinas to pick me up some sopa de gallina in their travels.  I must say, it was absolutely delicious and made me sweat like crazy all through the night.  Needless to say, my so-called strep (or whatever the hell it was??) which was accompanied by body aches and a slight fever became a thing of the past the next morning.  

There's nothing like some home cooked sopa like my abuelita used to throw down to cure my sickies!
author: Ally C.

description: My grandma lives next door to this place ha! its very good!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
If I'm ever in the mood for pupusas and don't want to drive all the way to the Mission, I come to Reina's because it is convenient. I always order the chicharones and frijoles pupusas. Something about this greasy goodness topped with the fermented cabbage and red hot sauce is nostalgic. I always make sure I place my order over the phone because the wait is ridiciulously long.

I've never ordered anything besides the pupusas, so based on my love for pupusas and Reina's ability to immediately fulfill my pupusa cravings, I give them 3 stars (minus 2 stars for always keeping me waiting for a really long time for my order & for being quite greasier than the other pupusas I've had before).
author: Anne Y.

description: My family and I love the Pupusas here at Reinas. They are worth the wait!
author: Junior M.

description: I used to like this place. Even though it's kind of tacky and old the food is really good. My husband and I went there this past Saturday and as usual it was full. We waited a few minutes and were never acknowledged. After about 10 minutes a table became free and we sat down. No one ever came over to clean it or give us any menus. 15-20 minutes later we're still sitting at a dirty table. Another couple comes in and right away they were given menus. It was like we were invisible, so we got up and left. We are never going back there again.
author: Marta T.

description: Best pupusas in SF! I drive from SB just to have their zucchini and cheese pupusas. Their revueltas or mixed pork chicharron, cheese and beans remind me of the pupusas my grandma used to make. I take mine to go because parking is difficult on Mission, careful about parking across the street in McDonalds because they are always on you. Try them, you won't regret it.
author: Gris G.

description: Good pupusas; slow service; no water refills; no cabbage for pupusas; tables too close together. Fairly easy to find free street parking.
author: Sam R.

description:
i first went to this Salvardorian restaurant years ago i my first impression was bad of this place. The pupusas had no favor and i left the place unsatified. So I gave it a second chance because i do believe in giving a second chances to make up for the first time and i order chicken enceballos. The chicken enceballo is grilled chicken pieces like a fajita but i guess it was Salvadorian style because it came out fried with smuther with onions trying to cover the fried skin...
Be sure if you go there to bring your PEPTO!!!! Or your ANTI-DIARREA because i got FOOD POISON!!!!
author: Emilio J.

description: I go to Reina's all the time they have the best panes con pavo there. Everything is pretty good there. I've had the panes, sopa de pollo, sopa de gallina, pescado frito, salpicon, bistek salvadoreno, empanadas de leche o frijol, platanos con frijol y crema, churrasco, and i'm sure im leaving some things out but they were all very good. I would've gave them 5 stars but the pupusas are just average.
author: Daniel R.

description:
I cleaned my plate of pupusas, of course...

The vinegar from the curtido soiled my lunch, though!

I'm accustomed to eating my pupusas using both a fork and a knife, but I could cut through these mushy things with a fork only. That isn't a good thing...

Texture counts for something!
author: Nathan W.

description:
You know it's going to be crap when 

1.) you see one of the cooks scraping burnt stuff from the grill--lots of it.
2.) another cook lets your cheese filling run out of the pupusas while he's cooking, and tries to wrap it up in tin foil fast so you don't see it (until you get home and it's too late)
3.) you hear "ding" and realize they're microwaving your rice and beans because the stuff they have out that's supposed to be sort of warm is sort of cold. (The beans were a bit pastey too.)
4.) they're talking to each other and doing every thing in slo-mo and talking to each other some more (as if you didn't exist)

P.S. The chips were stale.
author: Priscilla L.

description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE okay I made a phone order to pick up 20 min I went there one customer in front of me after they finished then the cashier starts talking to her freind at the side while I'm like wtf I'm next u can't talk after wards then she leaves the cashier to talk some more after roughly 5 min she came to deliver food to a customer after that I said hello customer while I'm still waiting another 3 min then a customer came in and she said can I help you to me  after there's a small line never coming back to this restaurant terrible I waited a total of 15 of a phone order and I hear that it takes 20-30 min to make the food oh btw the food it's soo dam greasy terrible
author: Alex L.

description:
Good shit.

We ordered like three things off the menu not knowing that it would be an enormous amount of food since most items include rice and beans and all that good stuff.

The enchiladas were different! Maybe I'm just wack when it comes to Salvadorian food but I've never had enchiladas like that. They were like, sweeter.

Oh shit the garlic shrimp dish I got was amazing though. I asked the waitress what her favorite shrimp item was and went with it. REALLY GOOD. The shrimp was grilled nicely and it just tasted great. 

Pupusas were pretty good. I really don't have much experience with pupusas so I can't really say if they were amazing or anything, but I enjoyed them.

I was really really really full after eating all this, but I still wanted more so I guess that's a good thing.

Yelp, why haven't you made me elite yet?
author: Edmund C.

description:
Not very good food, and the place is as slow as molasses. Avoid it unless you have no other alternative.

The "veggie" pupusas are cooked on the same surface as the greasy pork rind (chicharron), so a vegetarian diner in my company was unable to even eat her dish and the shrimp dishes came out so overcooked that they tasted like cardboard.

The Mexican food is even worse. Really, I'm not sure what everyone else thinks about the food, but I really thought this place was bad.
author: Hank S.

description:
Their pupusas are delicious... but their service is CRAP.

they ladies are kinda rude..maybe because they are so busy, but that still doesn't give them any reason to be rude to their customers.

Since I can't stand rude service, I usually order to go, so I don't have to deal with them. Parking is hard too. 

Good food, and good service should go hand in hand... not at this place unfortunately.
author: Martha G.

description: This a go to place when I'm craving pupusas. It good food for a good price. Pretty much anything on the menu is good. The only down size is location. Parking is difficult but most definitely worth the search.
author: Karina V.

description: I has my first taste of pupusas here. I was surely hooked from the start, but after exploring many other locations, I realized that this was NOT my favorite place. The pupusas are ok, I found them to be less flavorful than others, service is always decent.
author: Meghan L.

description: I use to be a regular here, the pupusas are decent  but definitely not the best!!! Service here sucks! I had this one incident I called in an order for some pupusas and when I arrived my food wasn't ready. I am usually pretty patient person but since I notice they were busy that day I waited additional 15mins. During my wait I saw one of the  cooks warming up food in the microwave using plastic grocery bag. I was so disgusted! When I notice my order was ready, I was next to be attended to, so to top it off the woman started helping the guy behind me. After clearly knowing I was waiting there longer and standing in front of the counter! I got upset and left...  Never again will I ever go back..
author: Karla O.

description:
I probably have a pupusa glazed look on my face right now as I write this because I just had two cheese and bean pupusas with rice and beans that were absolutely fabulous. The rice was perfect and the beans were so tasty. I love pupusas and have had them from other restaurants, but I love the ones here.

Yes, the service can be really crap, but that's the shortcoming of this restaurant. There were some dicey moments, and I'll share: when we asked to take something home, she brought out the foil but also picked up the pupusa with her fingers and dropped it in the foil then wrapped it. Uh, thanks. Also some questions remain whether or not the person who took out the garbage washed her hands after picking up the bin. Grody.

Husbandido loved the beef soup (it's not small by any means so be prepared). Lots of huge chunks of veggies and what was that? half a corn cob? Okay!

Parking can be tough after 5 when the neighborhood peeps check in back home. BTW You can also pick up your bootleg dvds from the dude sitting there selling them. Also beware the television and jukebox which can be deafening....the bootleg vendor often holds the remote! Go figure!
author: Charlene L.

description:
Service is extremely below-par. I used to live on Naglee seriously two blocks away, But we would call in our order and then still have to wait another 30 mins. I thought that was why we called in so we would'n't have to wait. No such luck.  O well.

My boyfriend claims that reina's makes the best carne asada burrito ever( and he loves burrito's) he says their meat actually has flavor and isn't cooked to death or too chewy. i love their tamales. 
      The best thing ever would have to be the Sopa de 7 mare...It had every  living sea creature in it. I never buy soups usually because i feel like it's wasting money on water, but you've never had this soup and that means a lot coming from me. The portion was so big i stuffed myself and there was still a bowl left over.  best $13 soup in my life.
author: Lyna K.

description:
The. Worst. Pupusas. EVER!!! 
My husband is Salvadorean and we eat pupusas all the time, so we know what a good pupusa tastes like. (Plus my mother-in-law taught me how to make them as well). On a recommendation from a non Salvadorean friend, we gave this place a try. The pupusas were raw dough. Not even cooked, no tasty cheese oozing out. Just raw dough and non-melted cheese. NASTY!! Avoid this place like the plague!! The pork and Yucca was just as gross. The pork was as hard as a hockey puck and completely inedible. I had what was suppose to be the chicken soup. No chicken to be found...just nasty chicken skin and fat. I took one sip and pushed the rest aside. 
Do yourself a favor and stay far away from this place. With so many tasty Pupusarias in the city, you can find one SO MUCH BETTER  THAN THIS!!!
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Great pupusas!!!!! 
Def recomend this restaurant to anyone who's up for salvadorian food !! If u want mexican food the same owner owns the taqueria in between concord and Allison ...Taqueria Reinas ... Great place as well!!!.. Def. Recomend it!!!!!. =]
author: Melissa G.

description:
Pretty good... I had been meaning to try it, as it is the closest waling distance to my place (aside from McDonald's which is directly across the street). The yellow awning above the place made me think it should be delicious for whatever reason.

Food was pretty good. Not the best ever, but by far form the worst. I expected a little better being in the Mission, but granted it is a bit far off the track.

We walked in and stood there for 2-3 minutes before anyone even greeted us. They were busy making pupusas, which granted looked veyr good. I ordered a carne asada burritto and my girl ordered a veggie nachos. The burritto was cheesy and delicious, maybe too cheesy? The nachos were NOT cheesy but had fresh avocados on it.

Next time I will try the pupusas.
author: K. C.

description:
This place has THE MOST CHEAP AND DELICIOUS PUPUSAS EVAR!  Yes. If you are a pupusa freak, I guarantee there is no place in San Francisco that makes pupusas better.  Possibly the world. Really cheap as well, two pupusas are about $3 or $4 bucks.

Nachos are awesome (carne asada nachos mmmm), all the soups are awesome, and so is pretty much anything else on the menu except the tamales and the vegetarian burritos (the tamales really almost made me hurl, so four stars instead of five for here).  If you like authentic little neighborhood restaurants  you'll love this place. The tiles that decorate the walls are beautiful as well...

I definitely agree that the waitresses do take a long time to take your order but this is a small restaurant and the woman who takes your order probably cooks, busses, and does dishes as well.  Just have a little time and patience when you walk in and whatever you do, order pupusas.
author: Mailah G.

description: As I am not familiar with latin foods, I only go here for pupusas and tamales. Anyways, this is the only place I will go to because it is the best compared to other places. It is cheap and delicious. The service is good and attentive. The pupusas can be a lil oily, but hey you can wipe the oil off with a napkin or something. My order: 2 pupusas:1 vegetarian and 1 beans and cheese, and a horchata =)
author: Shirley M.

description: Live in the Neighborhood, and use Reina's for Salvadoran Tamales, and Pupusas for my get dinner parties. Have enjoyed this place for many years and continue to go back. The food is very authentic, as I grew up with this type of cuisine. Also have enjoyed Platanos con crema y frijoles. All in all the food is pretty good.
author: Carlos F.

description: There should be minus stars, Papusas taste like cardboard. I also asked if I could get a vegetarian burrito & asked what vegetables they used...haha no veggies just burrito with no meat. I asked how much it would cost to put vegetables on their Vegetarian burrito, they wouldn't do it. tried to get vegetables on a plate, not without chicken she said.  So I got stuck with the "vegetarian?" burrito and it was the nastiest burrito ever.  Service sucks in this place. Never going back. 100's of better restaurants in the city.
author: Joey D.

description: As a Salvadorean I know Pupusa's, and Reina's was really pretty good. Not greasy and good cheese filling with Lorocco. The rest of the food was not too bad but i do recommend the Pupusas. They even have some "gourmet" ones that give a great variety for everyone.
author: shirley c.

description:
I bought a chicken and cheese quesedilla for about five or six bucks and it was hugemungous! It was fucking tasty too.

This is the place to get your money's worth.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Unfortunately me and my friend Victor went here to eat and came out with a bad taste.

My friend Vic had the Mexican variety which was a Chicken Burrito, but it had a lot of small bones and didn't care for it.

I on the other-hand had the Salvadorian variety and had some Pupusas which were way too salty and like one of reviewers before me said the servers were rude when I asked to break some change they were being smart asses about it and pretended to tear my bill in half as a joke, but seeing that was tired I didn't appreciate it either that or I just didn't understand the Salvadorian sense of humor  which is sarcastic bordering on the tactless rudeness. I'm used to Sarcasm in the Mexican and American sense, but that was straight up rude.

But overall I didn't care for this place.
author: Alberto L.

description: Delicious and authentic Salvadorian food. Love the pupusas and sopa de res. Staff is always friendly to me.
author: Francisco R.

description:
Please, be very careful about ordering pan pon pavo. The one I got the turkey meat was not only dark meat it was black. Really old turkey.
The sauce was good so, I ate it anyway but it made be gag really bad the smell of old meat in my mouth awful.. The Atol de elote was good.
Stick to the pupusas only!
author: Garfield G.

description: GREAT ZUCHINI PUPUSAS! You must try them, I like them with a lot of salsa (which is very spicy!). Try Salpicon and eat it on a warm tortilla with lime, hmmm hmmmm!
author: Olga G.

description: Went here last night and really enjoyed it.  My friend and I had the chicken pupusas w/ rice & beans and left w/ full bellies for $13.00.  My new fav. pupusa place.
author: Rebekah C.

description: Love this place!  I've been going to this place for 9 years!  Really good food!  Pupusa and burritos are THE BEST!!!!!  So is the Salsa!
author: Jasmine B.

description: The best pupusas in SF and great grilled chicken as well.  I usually get the quesadillas because they give you a huge one for only like $5.
author: Joseph D.

description: I am always in search for delicious tripe.  I guess it's because I don't have the desire to touch it and cook it.  It was Sunday and Don Pico's on El Camino is closed and I had a craving for menudo.  Yeah, for dinner and it wasn't because I had a hangover.  Ha!  DP has really good menudo (but, not as good as my Mom's as hers is out-of-this-world). So, we got into the car and just headed down Mission Street in search of good Mexican food.  Bingo!  A parking spot in front of Reinas.  Hmmm, must be fate.  The menudo is not as good as DP, but it wasn't bad.  The portion was very generous.  I never had Salvadorian food before so I really enjoyed the super thick handmade tortillas.  Loved the jukebox and got to listen to 3 songs by Jose Jose for quarters.  Yeah!  Place feels like home.  Mucho gracias!
author: Lizzie L.

description: I love visiting my old coworkers in Brisbane because I can always count on them taking me here.  I barely have pupusas and this place is close by and YUM!  The only thing I hate is looking for parking.  Then again, what did you expect from San Francisco?  I always get confused when I go here.  Do we sit down and they take our order? Or do we order at the register and then sit down?  Their pupusas are always extremely filling so I usually order two, one I take back home with me to Sacramento.
author: Antoinette O.

description: Reina's is a family resturant with authentic Salvadorian food. I enjoy everything on their menu. Come hungry because the portions are really big. I have also been here for family events and they will cater to your large group.
author: Dee Z.

description: I like their cheese, chicken and pork pupusa ( not all together) and cabbage relish. It's a bit greasy so it's not a food to eat regularly.
author: Marie G.

description: Good food......lousy service. If you are in the mood for authentic Salvadorean food I would be hard pressed to find a place that makes better pupusas. This little hole in the wall has among the best tasting cheese, beans, zucchini & mixed pupusas in the city. They also serve some of the tastiest Salvadoren dishes like Salpicon (shredded beef cured with lemon mixed with diced radishes, onion & mint) Camarones in Salsa Verde (Shrimp marinated in a green chile sauce) and their famous Sopa de 7 Mares ( Soup of the 7 Seas), a great seafood soup filled with fish, crustaceans & veggies! Perfect for those nursing a hangover! The main drawback of this place is the service. The waitress' are really slow on getting any orders to the table and you usually have to wait a good 40 minutes before your food is served. If you can get past that then you're in for some great food!
author: Jason B.

description: Their Pupusa is one of the best I've had in the city.(my favorite is zucchini  pupusa) So far everything we've ordered is more than average. Shrimp/egg soup and torta are also great ones.
author: chocho c.

description: yeah reinas when u got a craving for a great super vegetarian burrito,reinas has the best there is.very fresh tasting burrito
author: Bryan S.

description: This is my favorite place for pupusas because they are less greasy than any other place I've tried.  They are also not stingy about stuffing the veggie pupusas full of zuccini.  I like that my pupusas have a higher vegetable-to-cheese ratio.
author: Onki K.

description: The pupusa's are amazingly good but, like others have written, the service isn't that great. Always get the food to go, since there is a really foul homeless man in the neighborhood who likes to come in with his pants down (though they usually chase him away, it's a disgusting sight nonetheless).
author: John R.
